text: The company is likely using the 'free domain' as a loss leader to attract customers and then upsell them on more profitable services.
This is a clear case of deceptive advertising, plain and simple. They are using the word 'free' to lure customers into a contract they don't fully understand.
This is not just a business practice; it's a moral failing that exploits the trust of honest consumers.
The user's complaint is likely based on a misunderstanding of the offer's terms, which are probably clearly stated elsewhere.
The company is likely exploiting a loophole in consumer protection laws regarding the definition of 'free' in digital services.
This is a textbook example of how modern corporations prioritize profit over integrity, using deception as a standard business tool.
